thread.title: Marriotts Ridge girls basketball clinches programs first 2A West Region title
thread.title_full: Marriotts Ridge girls basketball clinches programs first 2A West Region title

author: Monica D&apos;Ippolito
title: Marriotts Ridge girls basketball clinches programs first 2A West Region title
text:
Marriotts Ridge girls basketball clinches programs first 2A West Region title Marriotts Ridge girls basketball Submitted photo 
Marriotts Ridge poses for a photo with the 2A West Region championship plaque after defeating Walkersville, 46-39, on Friday, March 3 at Walkersville High School. 
Marriotts Ridge poses for a photo with the 2A West Region championship plaque after defeating Walkersville, 46-39, on Friday, March 3 at Walkersville High School. (Submitted photo) Monica D'Ippolito Caption Marriotts Ridge vs. Liberty girls basketball 
Marriotts Ridge senior forward Sarah Blalock talks about the Mustangs, 39-38, win over Liberty on Monday, Dec. 12 at Marriotts Ridge High School. Blalock hit the game-winner with 4.6 seconds remaining to give her team its fourth-straight victory. (Monica D'Ippolito/BSMG) 
Marriotts Ridge senior forward Sarah Blalock talks about the Mustangs, 39-38, win over Liberty on Monday, Dec. 12 at Marriotts Ridge High School. Blalock hit the game-winner with 4.6 seconds remaining to give her team its fourth-straight victory. (Monica D'Ippolito/BSMG) Caption Marriotts Ridge vs. Liberty girls basketball 
Marriotts Ridge senior forward Sarah Blalock talks about the Mustangs, 39-38, win over Liberty on Monday, Dec. 12 at Marriotts Ridge High School. Blalock hit the game-winner with 4.6 seconds remaining to give her team its fourth-straight victory. (Monica D'Ippolito/BSMG) 
Marriotts Ridge senior forward Sarah Blalock talks about the Mustangs, 39-38, win over Liberty on Monday, Dec. 12 at Marriotts Ridge High School. Blalock hit the game-winner with 4.6 seconds remaining to give her team its fourth-straight victory. (Monica D'Ippolito/BSMG) Caption Marriotts Ridge girls basketball preview 
Marriotts Ridge girls basketball players Sarah and Caroline Blalock talk about their teams upcoming season at a recent preseason practice. (Monica D'Ippolito/BSMG). 
Marriotts Ridge girls basketball players Sarah and Caroline Blalock talk about their teams upcoming season at a recent preseason practice. (Monica D'Ippolito/BSMG). Caption Long Reach vs. Atholton girls basketball 3A East Region finals 
Atholton senior Francesca Vanegas talks about the Raiders' 53-44 win over Long Reach to clinch the 3A East Region title Friday, March 3 at Long Reach High School. Vanegas led her team with a game-high 16 points. (Monica D'Ippolito/BSMG) 
Atholton senior Francesca Vanegas talks about the Raiders' 53-44 win over Long Reach to clinch the 3A East Region title Friday, March 3 at Long Reach High School. Vanegas led her team with a game-high 16 points. (Monica D'Ippolito/BSMG) Caption Howard vs. Western girls basketball playoffs 
Howard senior Emileigh Scott talks about the Lions' 74-51 win over Western in the 4A North regional semifinal game on Wednesday, March 1 in Ellicott City. Scott led her team with 19 points and five rebounds. (Monica D'Ippolito/BSMG) 
Howard senior Emileigh Scott talks about the Lions' 74-51 win over Western in the 4A North regional semifinal game on Wednesday, March 1 in Ellicott City. Scott led her team with 19 points and five rebounds. (Monica D'Ippolito/BSMG) Caption Long Reach girls basketball beats Glenelg in 3A East playoffs 
Long Reach junior Kiana Williams talks about the Lightning earning a 58-36 win over Glenelg in the 3A East region semifinals on Wednesday, March 1. (Brent Kennedy/Howard County Times) 
Long Reach junior Kiana Williams talks about the Lightning earning a 58-36 win over Glenelg in the 3A East region semifinals on Wednesday, March 1. (Brent Kennedy/Howard County Times) 
The hosting Lions (20-3) overcame an early six-point deficit to cut the score, 15-10, after the first eight minutes. But defensively they did not have an answer for Mustangs' Sarah Blalock. 
The senior forward led her team in the regional semifinal against Winters Mill with 26 points, and on Friday continued to have the hot hand. She knocked down 10 of 14 from the field and scored 20 of the Marriotts Ridgeâ€™s 28 second-half points. 
Her performance helped the Mustangs extended its cushion to 10 at the half, but Walkersville cut the difference down to eight entering the final eight minutes.
